rules.title: Generic Variable Names
rules.message: Never use generic names like data, result, temp, info, item, value, obj, thing, stuff, foo, bar, baz, tmp, ret, val. Use domain-specific names instead.

rules.title: Redundant Conditional Returns
rules.message: Never write 'if (condition) return true; else return false' or equivalent. Return the condition directly.

rules.title: Ternary Returning Boolean Literals
rules.message: Never write 'condition ? true : false'. The condition is already boolean.

rules.title: Redundant Boolean Comparisons
rules.message: Never write '=== true', '=== false', '!== true', or '!== false'. Use the boolean directly.

rules.title: Magic Number Calculations
rules.message: Never compute at runtime what can be a constant. Pre-calculate time values and other derived constants.

rules.title: Generic Function Names
rules.message: Never use generic verbs like handle, process, do, run, execute, manage combined with generic nouns without specific context.

rules.title: Single-Letter Variables
rules.message: Never use single-letter variables except i, j, k as loop counters.

rules.title: var Declaration
rules.message: Never use var. Use const for values that won't be reassigned, let for values that will. Block scoping and temporal dead zone prevent common bugs.

rules.title: Loose Equality
rules.message: Never use == or !=. Use === and !== to avoid type coercion bugs. Type coercion rules are complex and lead to unexpected behavior.
